ygData.subject: RE: [archive-crawler] multiple ExtractorImpliedURI extractors in one crawl
ygData.msgSnippet: A third, simpler, option would be to edit the Processors.options file and create multiple entries for the extractor, each with a different name after the |.

Subject: RE: [archive-crawler] multiple ExtractorImpliedURI extractors in one crawl
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=163406187; y=krevGo23yaRxJ7SymyfgWaayKee80qBwTHA7C_5EIT4659xB
X-Yahoo-Profile: kristsi25

A third, simpler, option would be to edit the Processors.options file and
create multiple entries for the extractor, each with a different 'name'
after the |.

For example instead of just:
org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorImpliedURI|ExtractorImpliedURI

You'd have
org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorImpliedURI|ExtractorImpliedURI
org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorImpliedURI|ExtractorImpliedURI2
org.archive.crawler.extractor.ExtractorImpliedURI|ExtractorImpliedURI3
etc.

The limitation you are hitting is a UI issue in that each Processor must
have a unique name within its processing chain part. This provides the UI
with multiple names for the same Processor.

Note that you don't actually have to edit the Processor.options file as
such. You can simple create a jar file that contains a file name
Processors.options under a modules directory (i.e. same structure as the
Heritrix.jar). The contents of this file are then appended to what is found
in the Heritrix bundled file as long as you jar is in the Heritrix lib
directory. This, by the way, is how the DeDuplicator adds itself to the UI.

- Kris

> -----Original Message-----
> From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
> [mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Gordon Mohr
> Sent: 28. september 2007 22:28
> To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] multiple ExtractorImpliedURI 
> extractors in one crawl
> 
> Bjarne Andersen wrote:
> > Hi.
> > 
> > Would it be possible to add multiple ExtractorImpliedURI 
> extractors to one crawl.
> > I have a website where a trigger-URI should generate 3 other URIs.
> > 
> > Could this be done by adding three extractors with the same 
> trigger ? 
> > - or even more logical three build-patterns from the same trigger
> 
> It's certainly possible to have more than one 
> ExtractorImpliedURI, though the web UI is flawed in making it 
> unnecessarily hard; see:
> 
> http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HER-1068 
> <http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HER-1068> 
> 
> For now, you have to hand-edit a crawl order file to put more 
> than one Processor of the same implementing class into a 
> single processing-chain.
> 
> Another option to consider for situations where one URI 
> implies many, or the implied URIs can't be constructed with 
> the build-pattern, would be to write a Beanshell script which 
> does the required analysis/construction, and use the 
> BeanshellProcessor.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> 
> 
>  
>
